Tribal Hunter minifig is brillant. Its is one off the best minifigs I've
stu241273,"2010-05-17T13:48:09.14Z","Collectable hunter","A nice little figure, I like the quill and bow, but it's a shame it has the same accessories as the Robin Hood character. &nbsp
column2:
I got a spare feather for his headress.

As with the other collectable minifigs, the quality is not to the usual Denmark standard, so reduced marks have been allocated.
column3:
The printed body and legs are good though.

Overall neither the best nor the worst of the series.
",TRUE,4,4,2,5,4

column1: brixton,"2010-05-29T07:04:14.717Z","Impressive","I love the collectible mini-figure collection that Lego has released.&nbsp
column2: The Tribal Hunter is all decked out in his ""traditional"" attire and comes with a bow and arrow and two feather head pieces.&nbsp
column3: The colour scheme for the clothing is great.&nbsp
column4: My only real complaint with this mini-figure is the bow part of the set.&nbsp
column5: It fits awkwardly into the Tribal Hunter's hand and it tilted to the right.&nbsp
column6:
I do not think he can hold it straight.
",TRUE,4,4,4,4,4

column1:
Firox_5000,"2010-08-21T18:41:30.8Z","Nice little Indian","

This figure is part of the series 1 minifig collection. He has 7 pieces and takes no longer than two minutes to build.
The figure has a sort of happy face with blue and red printing to give him an indian look. His chest and legs have a
column2: stripy print on them giving him which is very nicely done. He also has a not bad head piece which has long indian plats going down with a small atachable feather piece which can be attached on top.

column1: The set also includes the classic arrow and arrow storage pieces which are also included in the forestman of the series too.

column2: has a fare playability in a western and forest setting and could go well as a counter part to the cowboy or mexican in series 2.

column1:
I recomend him , I would describe him as one of the mediocre figures in this series. The figure is now sold out in the shops so you can probably only get him in ebay now.

",TRUE,4,4,4,4,2

buddy,"2010-06-01T15:05:45.093Z","Tribal Hunter? What is it hunting?","

01 Tribal Hunter

I got this minifig over a month ago, back at the end of April. This minifigure is one of my many favourites from Series 1, with its bow and arrow and new torso and leg printing. Although, it has lots of good points, there are also some bad ones:
• Feathers in its hair, is a nice touch
• Accurately detailed bow and arrow and quiver
• Accurately designed face, has red indian face painting
• New torso and leg prinitng have high detail
<li>Price is a bit too high for my liking, <SPAN lang=EN-GB style=""FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt
column4: mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"">£1.99, I would have prefered <SPAN lang=EN-GB style=""FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt

column7: mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"">Could have had something extra, specifically an animal to hunt such as a Pig

mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"">In conclusion, I would recommend this minifigure over some of the others in Series 1, but I think that an animal that the hunter could be hunting maybe could or should have been included.
mso-ansi-language: EN-GB"">I rank this minifigure my 9th favourite out of Series 1.

column1: icepick,"2010-07-15T17:44:53.32Z","Very cool minifig","This is one of the only four of this series that I bothered to buy.&nbsp
column2: I really like the look of this guy.&nbsp
column3: He has great detail without being too noisy.&nbsp
column4:
I love his long hair.

They are only $1.99 which seems steep to some, but it's very comparable to other sets, and I felt it was a really great deal.
",TRUE,5,5,5,5,5

column1: Brickmeister1138,"2011-02-26T11:26:25.3Z","A Minifig Perfect for any Western","
column9: mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'""> The tribal hunter is a well done minifig that has both intricate torso and leg printing, but it is very similar to the Native Americans origionally released in the Western theme. Because of this, it is best suited to filling out the ranks of the tribes one already has from that line.

column1:
CamberbrickGreen,"2011-09-25T06:04:46.973Z","First Nations People","Subtheme: Wild West

An excellent minifigure:
column2: A lovely print of leather clothing design and great to see natives back in production. It would be great to represent many global native types, at least North American tribes. Rather than just more used feathered plains/ desert tribe designs, some northwest Nootka &amp
column3:
Haida would look great as well as the southwest such as the Hopi clowns.

This is also a vast improvement from the original Cowboys theme while adding much refinement to the overall impression of the character and culture.

Nice beads, tassels, face paint and grin! This release fits in to the wild west themed

column1:
woodall_aidan,"2012-04-07T10:47:22.173Z","8683-1 Tribal Hunter","This set is a great set! It is the tribal hunter form Series 1 minifigures. The tribal hunter comes with a Native American hairpiece with decorated white feathers. The head is a yellow face with a very happy looking smile and face paint on the cheekbones. The torso is tan with beads and a blue and white pattern. The legs are tan as well, but with more blue and white patterns. The figure also comes with a bow and quiver. I give this set a 4/5 because it should have had a bit more detail, maybe on the arms, though.
",TRUE,4,3,2,3,4

column2: Tribal Hunter is a very detailed and fun minifigure. It`s got a nice body design including a zig-zag pattern on his torso and some facepaint on his cheeks. However,&nbsp
column3: the accessories had already appeared in the discontinued Western theme. If you own the Tribal Hunter, Cowboy (Series 1) and&nbsp

column1:
Overall, i think this is a great set and if you can get your hands on it, get it!

",TRUE,4,3,1,4,3
whalemaster,"2011-04-20T18:16:15.187Z","Great Tribal Guy!","I rate this dude a 4/5 because it was a great time building this!&nbsp
column2: I think that you can even give his bow and arrow to a farmer and make him try to shoot his pigs.&nbsp
column3:
But of course the farmer would not know how to use it and eventually shoot himself. this guy comes with very good parts and he would be good for a western scene.
",TRUE,4,2,3,5,5

column1:
sideswinger,"2020-07-09T01:47:02.08Z","A pretty good figure!","

So the Tribal Hunter is the first figure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 1, and while he isn'
column2: t my favorite of the series, he definitely isn&#39
column3: t my least favorite either. He was also only 2 bucks though, so it isn&#39
column4: t exactly top-notch, but still, it is a nice figure. Let&#39

column1: So on top we have that hair, with really looks nice or this figure. I really like how the strands hang down in front of his torso, and it is just a very nice hair piece all around. I originally thought it was new for the figure but it was first introduced in an old LEGO Western theme, so it isn'
column2: t new, but it still works for the figure. And as you can see, he has that feather attachment on top, which looks great with the black printing on the tips.

column1: Next we have his head, which has a nice face print. I like his big smile and eyebrows, and he also has those red and black lines on either side of his face, which make him look very indian-like. And the face is not double-sided, but that'
column2: s okay because it was only 2 dollars.

column1: And then his torso has some nice printing as well, with that blue beaded necklace, as well as the feathers that hang down from it, and I like the bad printing on his waist, which looks great. And I'
column2: m not positive on this, but I don&#39
column3: t think he has back torso printing, which again, is okay since it was only 2 bucks.

column1: And then he does have some really intricate printing on the top of the legs with that blue and white design, and he has some other printing on the legs as well with the lines by his nees and all.
And his accesories are cool as well, with that brown quiver, and then he also has the brown bow as well, which were not new, but still
column2: they look very nice, and go right along with the rest of the figure.
s it for this guy! Thanks for reading, and I hope you enjoyed it!
